author: ryanleeschneider
content:
RE: testnet fork epochs: I see that erigon for example released 2.56.0 with only the Goerli fork date set (no timestamps set for Sepolia or Holesky).  Is this the pattern all teams are planning to take?  Also is this because https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8051 and https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/pull/860 are still open?

edit: I see, there was dicussion about this here: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/892088344438255616/1192739217932034098

author: abcoathup
content: My understanding were releases for Goerli Jan 17, then assuming no issues, single client releases for Sepolia Jan 30 & Hole≈°ky Feb 7
